definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: It is quite baffling why he should have made such remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他为什么讲这番话，真叫人莫名其妙。

sentences.english: I just get my parole, and do not want to be your scapegoat somehow.
sentences.chinese: 我才刚刚假释耶，不想莫名其妙的变成你的代罪羔羊。

sentences.english: The 750 million yuan deficit somehow got rounded up to 800 million yuan.
sentences.chinese: 七亿五千万的赤字莫名其妙地达到了八亿。

sentences.english: Missing is a power that can draws one's tears unintelligibly.
sentences.chinese: 思念就一种可以让人莫名其妙地掉下眼泪的力量。

sentences.english: Half the time I get an odd result.
sentences.chinese: 一半的时间，得到的结果都是莫名其妙。

sentences.english: Idle thoughts floated through his mind.
sentences.chinese: 莫名其妙地想法浮现在他心头。

sentences.english: Theie reason for doing it is still a puzzle to me.
sentences.chinese: 他们为什么要做此事我仍莫名其妙。

sentences.english: Most of the left has followed this confusing usage.
sentences.chinese: 多数左派迄今都是沿用的这个莫名其妙的用法。

sentences.english: Consequently, you may experience fatigue or listlessness without realizing why.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你可能会莫名其妙地感到疲劳或无精打采。

sentences.english: And yet, somehow, Deadpool has won audiences' hearts.
sentences.chinese: 不过他就这样莫名其妙地赢得了观众的心。

sentences.english: There is no substitute for in comprehensible good luck.
sentences.chinese: 莫名其妙的好运气，没有东西可代替。

sentences.english: Now it's a point of pride in a weird way.
sentences.chinese: 现在行为怪异反倒让人有种莫名其妙的自豪感。

sentences.english: It beats me how she can have done it.
sentences.chinese: 我感到莫名其妙，她怎么竟然做出这样的事。

sentences.english: There's been a lot of unusual sackings lately, which I've found hard to understand.
sentences.chinese: 最近有很多人莫名其妙的丢了工作，我觉得很难理解。

sentences.english: He has such a panic fear after the traffic accident.
sentences.chinese: 车祸过后他感到一种莫名其妙的后怕。

sentences.english: He was already frightened at the suspicion that had fallen upon him, without quite knowing why.
sentences.chinese: 他已经被这个莫名其妙地把他牵连在内的嫌疑吓昏了。

definition: no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
perfectly all right/without rhyme or reason
to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/between laughter and tears
